Description:
Location, Location with 5 Star Energy Rating on 817m2
For more than meets the eye, this contemporary open plan home is architecturally designed, approximately 2yrs old and only one block from the historic main street of Clunes. With versatility in mind, the study/library or second living area can also be used as the 2nd bedroom when unexpected guests arrive. Floating bamboo flooring features throughout the home and French doors provide wonderful light and cross ventilation. Fully insulated, the reverse cycle heating/cooling plus a carbon neutral ethanol fire place takes care of climate control. Careful design has ample storage both inside and out. The huge two way bathroom includes a foot spa and full length window for a relaxed tiered garden view along with the recently established orchard set to produce a wide variety of fruits to enjoy.
Attention to detail with this property is a must see for the serious buyer.
For more information regarding this property please contact Jo Millar on 0438 081 301 or Angela Flowers on 0437 456 908
Insights: 88a Bailey Street, Clunes VIC 3370 was last sold in 2016 and 7 other 2 bedroom house in Clunes have recently been sold.

Description:
Old State Bank part of Clunes History
A building with iconic early goldfields architecture, this building was built in the 1870s and displays many of the original period features.
Featured in the 2003 movie starring Heath Ledger, the building has a shop space with original bank counter and vault along with a grand living area upstairs with 5 bedrooms.
There is also a large cellar attached to the kitchen downstairs, signifying an era of grandeur fit for the prestigious position afforded a bank manager.
In fact, older members of the community remember invitations to the grand balls held upstairs in the formal living area being the most sought after in town.
Clunes itself is well known for its book town weekend whereby thousands of visitors converge on the tiny town as well as having been the backdrop for Mad Max and Halifax FP.
The building is ready to be shop and bed and breakfast with separate entrances to the commercial and residential wings.
All the hard work has been done in getting this building up to date.
New spouting downpipes and repaired valley, massive earthworks to re-expose the floor vents, heating and cooling installation, roof insulation, sewer connections including connection points for new bathroom in bultlers pantry, landscaped garden just needing final touch, new circuit boards for commercial and residential occupancy,
all that is left is the fun stuff.
For those who seek affordable grandeur and wanting a tree change whilst making an income from having a business, this building affords multiple business opportunities and residential splendor in beautiful country.
Mark Timmins : 0488 547 004
Insights: 28 Fraser Street, Clunes VIC 3370 was last sold in 2016 and 3 other 5 bedroom house in Clunes have recently been sold.

Description:
Historic Commercial Building with Period Style Residence
A building with iconic early goldfields architecture, this building was built in the 1870s and displays many of the original period features. Featured in the 2003 movie starring Heath Ledger, the building has a shop space with original bank counter and vault along with a grand living area upstairs with 5 bedrooms. There is also a large cellar attached to the kitchen downstairs, signifying an era of grandeur fit for the prestigious position afforded a bank manager. In fact, older members of the community remember invitations to the grand balls held upstairs in the formal living area being the most sought after in town.
Clunes itself is well known for its book town weekend whereby thousands of visitors converge on the tiny town as well as having been the backdrop for Mad Max and Halifax FP. The building is ready to be shop and bed and breakfast with separate entrances to the commercial and residential wings.
All the hard work has been done in getting this building up to date. New spouting downpipes and repaired valley, massive earthworks to re-expose the floor vents, heating and cooling installation, roof insulation, sewer connections including connection points for new bathroom in bultlers pantry, landscaped garden just needing final touch, new circuit boards for commercial and residential occupancy, all that is left is the fun stuff.
For those who seek affordable grandeur and wanting a tree change whilst making an income from having a business, this building affords multiple business opportunities and residential splendour in beautiful country.

Description:
10.82 Acres with Livestock Thrown In
An opportunity to invest in a superb 10.82 acres or 4.381 hectares of land has arisen. This acreage divided into seven paddocks is; fenced, has two dams, shedding and established trees. A good looking flat level parcel of land provides a cosy caravan attached to the 12 x 10m shed, which boasts four bays and two roller doors, to create a pleasant and convenient spot to have a bite to eat or take a rest. This shed also provides some added kitchen facilities if you wished to stay a little longer.
Located just minutes from the iconic township of Clunes, 30 minutes from Ballarat CBD and 10 minutes to Miners Rest, this property offers a gravel driveway, with East and West boundaries beautified with excellent tree shelter for livestock. A new submersible pump, driven by a generator provides bore water to stock troughs and dams, whilst the fencing is in good condition overall. With a little investigation and with other nearby properties providing permission to build in the past 12 months, this property, whilst zoned 'Farming', may provide a similar ability in the future.
This sale includes some added extras with a number of sheep, goats and ponies to begin your livestock requirements. You couldn't ask for anything more. Our agent has all the details of just how many, so call today to check out the particulars. Buy now and reap the revenue in the future.
Insights: 84 Heath Street, Clunes VIC 3370 was last sold in 2016.

Description:
Great Potential on 3.5 acres
If it's space you're looking for you can't go past this 4 bedroom renovators delight. Finish what the vendors started. Add your own personal touch to this family home with most of the hard work done. Property also includes a concrete slab with stumps and connections for a granny flat and concrete slab prepared for 4 car garage. Set well back on the block for privacy, this one is for the buyer with a vision to see this property reach its full potential.
Features include:
Polished timber flooring, new kitchen, 900mm stove, dishwasher, solar power which feeds back into the grid, split system, wood heating, large pantry, loads of storage, 2x bathrooms, 2x living, study or activity space, veranda on two sides, sundry shedding, circular drive, dam, lightly treed, on school bus route and only a few minutes to centre of township.
For more information please contact Jo Millar 0438 081 301 or Angela Flowers 0437 456 908

Description:
Sustainable Self Sufficient Lifestyle
If you have ever wanted to live a sustainable lifestyle then this is the property for you. All the planning, preparation and hard work to setup has been done.
This 10 hectare property features a north facing, open plan, 2 bedroom residence. Light and bright this solar powered home is warm in Winter with a free standing wood fire along with Winter sun through the well appointed windows. Summer is taken care of with block out blinds and well positioned veranda. Kitchen features timber bench tops with beautiful views across the property. A separate utility area is ideal for sewing, computing or a creative space. Sit on the front deck constructed by Apollo Patios and watch the abundant bird life in the well established landscaped gardens. The large DLUG also doubles as a large entertaining area with access directly into the house. Ample water is supplied by the 45,500 litre rain water tanks, 3 dams and the spring fed seasonal creek.
The raised vegetable garden makes life easier to tend your crop while taking advantage of the variety of fruit trees throughout the garden. A sweet little chicken coup completes the scene. With so much more to see, book for inspection today.
Insights: 185 Beckworth Court Road, Clunes VIC 3370 was last sold in 2016 and 7 other 2 bedroom house in Clunes have recently been sold.

Description:
Ultimate Lifestyle Ideal for the Horse Enthusiasts
With an appealing mixture of bushland and grazing this 80 acres offers the horse enthusiast the space to enjoy long rides through the bush and beyond, while the infrastructure of a timber fenced large round yard with adjoining horse stable, various fenced paddocks, dressage arena, a generous 3 bay shed with two further stables and lock up workshop compliment this superb property.
Perfectly set on a slight rise overlooking the substantial dam come mini lake, this fascinating home has been constructed from concrete blocks, colour bond roof plus a feature granite wall to the East. Large windows, high skylights and open rafters provide ample light to penetrate through the entire living area which incorporates an elongated kitchen, living and dining room while a freestanding combustion heater provides plenty of warmth across the entire space. Three bedrooms are generous in size with the master room featuring a double vanity ensuite. This home has taken on its own earthy style with its granite feature wall to master and main living zone and timber cathedral ceilings, yet also provides contemporary bones to compliment any further dcor additions.
Undercover parking is available via a rear double carport, which also protects the home against harsh rays through the summer periods, plus the enormous shed offers further vehicle or machinery cover as previously mentioned. Situated only minutes from the gorgeous historic township of Clunes, this unique property will certainly interest a combination of buyers. From horse fanatics to bush lovers, right through to those who just need room to move. Just 30 minutes to the outskirts of Ballarat and a quick 15 minutes to the thriving township of Creswick, this property is ready for your inspection. Call today for further details.
Insights: 135 McKinleys Road, Clunes VIC 3370 was last sold in 2016 and 17 other 3 bedroom house in Clunes have recently been sold.

Description:
Heritage Home c.1870
Situated in a quiet location on 3/4 of an acre, 'Hillcrest', once a show piece property, has huge potential to reclaim the crown. The two story brick & blue stone has many of the original features as evidence of the prosperous mining period in Clunes. Includes 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, 2 living areas, kitchen with butlers pantry/ladder and open fire places with period mantles.
A most unique opportunity to own a special piece of history.
For further information please contact Jo Millar 0438 081 301 or Angela Flowers 0437 456 908

Description:
Bay Tree House on 2 titles
This period style 3 bedroom home with study has a number of options for you to consider when contemplating your 'Tree Change'. Located within easy walking distance to the historical main street and café precinct of Clunes, this property has much to offer. Sit by the open fireplace with timber mantle surround or take in the beautiful morning sunshine via the large colonial windows that feature in the lounge/dining room.
Also included split system air conditioner. Combustion wood heating for the family room and a number of original lead light windows throughout. Complete with easy care garden, this property also has rear vehicle access. From the tessellated tiles at the front door to the lock up multi-purpose heritage shedding at the rear, with double carport and even more storage shedding, this one is definitely worthy of inspection.
To arrange inspection please contact Jo Millar on 0438 081 301

Description:
Charming Acreage Property Just Three Minutes To Clunes
This sweet property may be the perfect weekender or the private get-away you've always wanted. A young weatherboard with two spacious bedrooms, the abode has a true sense warmth and love. The home has a great country feel, while display modern comforts such as reverse a/c. Set on a picturesque 3.85 acres, the outlooks are splendid. The land is ideal for a couple of horses and there is ample shedding for car coverage, workshops, storage and stables.

Description:
Location, location, location on 1584m2
Just a short stroll to the cafes of Clunes is this ideally located weatherboard home. Offering three good sized bedrooms, roomy kitchen featuring an electric St George cooker, central heating/cooling, slow combustion wood heating and solar HWS. Open plan living/dining adds to the spacious feel with it's large windows including sunblinds and impressive outlook across the sports oval. Colorbond single lock up garage and double carport for car cover with raised garden at the rear. Within 30 minutes drive of Ballarat, Daylesford and Maryborough. Don't miss this opportunity to secure a very comfortable home with 'Booktown' at your fingertips.
For further information please contact Jo Millar on 0438 081 301.

Description:
4.4 Acres with Planning Permit
Looking for a tree change to build your lifestyle property? This may be just what you've been looking for. All the paperwork is done. Water meter connected and power at the front gate. The solid driveway makes a tidy entrance from the bitumen frontage and there's a gravel track for rear access. Planning permit valid to June 2017. Relax and watch the native wildlife amongst the mature Gum trees. This property consists of two paddocks, is fully fenced and located less than 5 mins drive from the heart of Clunes and all it has to offer. Also available for sale is a 40ft (12m) reconditioned shipping container ideal for camping in. Features windows, wood heater, kitchenette whirly gig.
Only 25 mins drive to Ballarat or Maryborough. Inspect today!
For more information: Jo Millar 0438 081 301 or Angela Flowers 0437 456 908
Insights: 209 Fairview Drive, Clunes VIC 3370 was last sold in 2016.

Description:
Two Acres, House And A Bungalow!
An ideal hobby farm with a genuine country feel is ready for inspection. Three bedrooms plus an additional bungalow set on two acres, just minutes from the historic township of Clunes. Move on from the bustle of the city, this property offers full rural fencing, peace and quiet along with views across your land and beyond.
Freshly painted and warmed with new plush carpet, this home offers a split system for touch of the button' convenience, and a free standing wood heater to create a toe warming' heat through the colder months. Generous rooms ensure this home is light filled and the floor to ceiling windows allows additional light and warmth to stream in. Whilst this spacious home has a room dedicated to an ensuite, this area has not been fully completed for use - a perfect chance to add your own flair! The master is very generous in size with a massive walk in robe, and a further area to relax in the sun. The second bedroom has mirrored robes whilst the third bedroom or the external bungalow could be converted to a study or home office. The family bathroom and laundry offer a fresh clean feel and are positioned perfectly to service the entire home. The kitchen provides stainless steel appliances with gas and electric cooking facilities and is evident by the open plan that many family and guests have dined and mingled in this dining space which spills out to the adjoining paved alfresco.
The bungalow has been constructed inside the large storage shed to the side, with wood panelling and ceiling fan, to provide a further space for guests to stay or just an area for kids to hang out. This much loved home is perfect for those wishing to add a vegetable patch, grow some fruit trees or just have room to run a few animals Be sure to contact our girls in our Creswick office for further details and inspection times.
Insights: 3565 Ballarat-Maryborough Road, Clunes VIC 3370 was last sold in 2018 and 17 other 3 bedroom house in Clunes have recently been sold.

Description:
Fully Renovated 3 Bedroom Cottage circa 1870's
Set on approximately 1500sqm, this tastefully decorated and fully renovated 3 bedroom Miners Cottage with Studio is perfect for a weekend getaway or make it your permanent home. Home includes charming lead light windows, polished timber floors, high ceiling feature in living area and bay window in one bedroom, en-suite/ two way bathroom, all new appliances with instantaneous lpg gas hot water service. A quirky restored shed at the rear is an ideal studio, rumpus or man/lady cave. Carport for car or caravan.
For more information please contact:
Jo Millar 0438 081 301 or Angela Flowers 0437 456 908
